clock

Class Clock

  • java.lang.Object
    • clock.Clock
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Clock
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The Projector class simply takes an image, and projects it in either full screen mode, or in a JPanel for a given FPS value.      This class sets up the nitty gritty details for a refreshing frame in use for a game or other simulation. Here's a quick example for how to use Projector: 
     
  public class yourClass implements Pinterface
  {
        private Projector ip;
        private BufferedImage bi;
        private JPanel jp;
  
        public yourClass()
        {
                bi = new BufferedImage(400, 400, BufferedImage.TYPE_INT_ARGB);
                ip = new GProjector(10f, bi, "Test", this);
                jp = ip.init(new Dimension(400, 400));
                //or just ip.init() for full screen.
        }
  
        public void iUpdate()
        {
        //Code that updates bi, goes here.
                }
        }
    Since:
    1.6 Bug fix to the way thread was created., 1.5 Several small convenience fixes have been made.
    Version:
    1.7 FSEM implemented for init() method.
    Author:
    Brian Nakayama
